page.title: 03Transport: St. Erth Station
page.content: St.Erth Station is a small station next in line to Penzance, the terminal point on the main line Paddington to Penzance and other routes from the north. It owes its importance to the fact that it is the branch line to St.Ives, a busy holiday resort. The station is at present manned by four British Rail employees, a signalman, a clerk in the Parcels Office, another in the booking office and a Charge Hand who looks after the coming and going of the trains. On the Summer timetable a dozen trains stop on the down line to Penzance and fourteen on Saturdays.
